bboxes.raw_text:
LANCASTER, PA. - Sixteen
young men and women from lead
ing colleges and universities have
been named "Young Men and
Women of the Year" through a
special cooperative awards pro-
gram sponsored by Hamilton
Watch Company, of Lancaster.


The awards, engraved Hamil-
ton watches, were presented to
Phyllis j. johnson and Roosevelt
Holloman, Florida A and M Uni
versity. Tallahassee; June Marie
Smith and Jasper Bowman, john
son c. Smith University, Char
lotte NC; Joyce f. Wooden and
Frank A. Mathewson. Jr., Vir-
gtnia State College, Petersburg;
Marchusa N. Armstrong and
George f. Francis, Prairie View
A and M College, Texas; Will
lornita Smith and A. Frazier
Curry, Kentucky State College.
Frankfort; George Edgecomb and
Addie Shropshire, Clark College,
Atlanta; Claudia Blow and Donald
Cotter, Lincoln University, JEFF
ferson City, Mo-; Karen f.
BrOWnlee and Dennis j. Fisher,
Morgan State College, Baltimore.
Mr.. Fisher. a blind student.
received cash award.

Humilton Wutch Co.
Names Award Winners

TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -
Eighteen Negro demonstrators
were injured and many we're
arrested after police refused
them marching permission.


Fire hoses and tear gas we're
used to Subdue the crowd which
threw rocks and bottles. Officers
pushed the crowd into the First
African Church.


The Rev. T.Y. Rogers, exec
utivp director of the Tuscaloosa
Citizens for Action committee
was arrested.

In memory of Rev. c. B:
Abortion, who departed from
us on June 2, 1862. He is gone
but not forgotten.


We have Travelled along the
lanes. We have travelled along
the highways. In the sunshine and
in the powerful rain.


Sometimes we have Travelled
in the darkness of night. Some
times the way was not easy,
but we found joy together. Until
God called and you answered.


The battle was fought, the VIC
tory has been won. You have
entered the Ma ster's joy. Though
our hearts are heavy with the
sorrows that we must bear. It
surely brings us closer to God.


From the wife, children,


grandchildren, great grand


children, other relatives and


host of friends.

Sunday is an important meeting
date for the PISA convention COM
mittee. All members are asked
to be present at $3.50 pm.


A junior matinee hop will be
held Sum-, June IA, Al pm.
Small children accompanied by
parents will be admitted for 25c.


PISA Convention will be held
in the city June 24-28. VIII.
Patteson Lodge AT and Grand
Canyon Temple 437 will cohost
the meet.


Sick list includes Elizabeth
Turner Memorial Hospital, w.
&c.


Shirley Billips underwent sur
gerry at Memorial.


Beatrice Jackson is i'll at home,
81 L. Monroe.


Senolia Johnson is i'll at home,
1918 w. Cocopah.


Come out and join the ElkS
Singers - music will be needed
for the PISA convention. First
rehearsal Thursday, June IL.


Flower makers are needed at
8 pm. that night, too. We need
lots of decorations for our
parade.

Large corner lot. 8 bedrm.
and garage. Shady back. Ideal
for children. Small down, balance
like rent. 46l8 s. 9th Place,
969-03ls.

2 bedrooms, new apt. coolers,
built-in range /oven. See resident
mgr. at corner of 6632 S. 22nd
St. and Vineyard Apt. $65 mo.
including free water. 276-8250.

YARD THIS WEEKEND OPENING

235 Id. top quality asbestos
shingles so. 1893
